turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What's wrong with me?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I swear to you they've done everything humanly possible. The best plastic surgeons in the world, Ben. You had the best --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Give me a mirror...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: They said that's not such a good idea, the shock alone could --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Give me the god damn mirror!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey! That's a prototype!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Go back to the drawing board.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The machine works. And Vic's gone Mister Hyde on us --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Really? With a name like Von Doom? Never saw that one coming.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No more cracks about how I look.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey, I'm Mr. Sensitivity now.  Clear the way, wide load coming through.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Your tissue, your organs, your entire biophysical structure is changing. Every system is still functioning, somehow --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: And they're changing into...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I don't really know. A compound organic-metallic alloy. Stronger than titanium or carbon steel. Harder than diamonds --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Like the shields Reed said would protect us.  How long?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: At this rate, the infection should be complete in two, maybe three weeks --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What do you mean "complete"?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I wish I could tell you. I can't pretend to know what we're dealing with here. I'll notify the CDC and --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The Center for Disease Control. If this thing is contagious --

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But... this disease... is progressive... degenerative...

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: That's terrible news...

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: And where do we think we're going?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I don't know if "we've" noticed, but the sickest runs this side of the Alps are right outside that window --

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: You're hot!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: So are you!

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: I mean, you feel a little feverish.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I've never felt better in my life. When do you get off work?

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: My shift ends at four, but I couldn't --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Meet me at 4:01, top of the run. That'll give you a minute to freshen up.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Me like-y.

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: Stay right. Left is trouble.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I though we went over this.

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: Last one down springs for room service.

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: You're on fire!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Not this again --

turns.speaker: SEXY NURSE
turns.text: No: You're ON FIRE!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Victor's right. Johnny, get to the command center. Close the shields.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's not responsive --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Ben! Ben!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Now what is up with that?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The cloud has fundamentally altered our DNA.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Cool. What'd it do to you guys?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Oh, you dawg you. Better not be my nurse!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, are you there?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: This is wrong in so many ways.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You've been working out.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben Grimm is a genuine American hero who's been through a terrible orde--

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What he's trying to say is: every team needs a mascot...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Twenty? From outside the place looks a lot taller.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Oh, it is.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We should stay here until we can define the extent of our changes...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: This place is deluxe. You got cable?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: ...and figure out how to reverse them. Let me show you to your rooms.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Back it down, Johnny!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I can go hotter!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Not only could you kill yourself, but you could set fire to Earth's atmosphere and destroy all human life as we know it.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Gotcha. Okay. Supernova bad.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Is there something about flames? About flaming, that you --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What are you trying to say? Just because I dress well and like to dance --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: What? No. I'm trying to figure out why we each ended up with different symptoms.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Oh, well that's easy: I'm hot. You're... well, you're a little limp. Sue's easy to see through. And Ben's always been a hardass.  Why aren't you writing this down?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He's right. These costumes are... missing something. I can't put my finger on it --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: They're not costumes.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: That's what I'm trying to calculate. And it's not rubber. It's muscle, tendon. I seem to have the ability to manipulate the malleability of my molecular structure and redistribute my density to --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Right, whatever, have fun.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You need to control yourself and think before you --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Act. Here we go again. Reed, what if we got these gifts for a reason? What if we have some, you know... like, calling?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: A higher calling like getting girls and making money?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Johnny. SUPERNOVA.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: But all these people...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: The synthetics act as a second skin, adapting to your individual needs to --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Keep the hot side hot, and the cool side cool!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Apparently I can disappear.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Please tell me you go silent too.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Flame on, flame off. Flame on, flame off --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Johnny.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Okay, "mom."

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What is that thing?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I think that thing is Ben.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Wait. You mean there's chance we could be full-on-24-7-fantastic?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Grow up, Johnny. You want to run around on fire for the rest of your life?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Is that a trick question? C'mon, I can't be the only one who thinks this is cool.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You're really cramping my style here.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You were at 4000 Kelvin. Any hotter, you're approaching supernova --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Sweet.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: That's the temperature of the sun.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Uh, we call my sister the invisible girl... the Invisible Girl.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Girl...?!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm driving.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Dude. That's my sister.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You're gonna pay for that, Pebbles.  What?!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You gave us names? What are you, the "face" of the Fantastic Four now?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You two need a time-out.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Blockhead started it!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Johnny? Did you see Ben?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Yeah, for the last time, I hope. I'm done with this freak show. I'm moving back to the real world.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Is that what you call it? "Real"?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: At least it beats living in a lab like somebody's science project.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Johnny, slow down. Think. You know mom didn't raise us to --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Look around, sis! She's not here. So you can stop talking to me like I'm your little boy --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: As soon as you stop acting like one. Come on, you're smarter than this. You think those people out there care about you? You're just a fad to them.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I'm sorry, sis, for leaving you guys --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No, I'm sorry, for pushing you out.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What are you doing --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Sis. Let me take care of you for once.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: But Johnny... you can't fly.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: If Reed's right, then this little trip will double our stock offering.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: And if he's not...?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Reed's always right. Good thing he doesn't always know what he's got...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: They're ready for you, sir.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Showtime.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Our numbers are through the roof. The IPO's tracking at fifty, sixty a share. The bank's five times oversubscribed --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It's not just the money. I could make money in my sleep.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Then what is it?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: History, Leonard. History. Everything else is conversation...  How's the other matter?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Leonard, how's the feed?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Recording, sir. We see you perfectly.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: How's the IPO?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Stable. We're looking at low twenties. It's a good number, considering the fallout from --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Reed's disaster. You know, I half- think he did this to me on purpose.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Sir, I'm sure he wouldn't put himself --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Get me on the AM shows, Larry King, cover of the Journal...  I've got to do something about this scar. Make sure they only shoot my right side.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Actually, uh, people seem to think the scar "humanizes" you.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: And that's a good thing?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You know, maybe you should get some rest --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Later. First, I've got some unfinished business. A deal that needs closing...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Sir, I've always wondered... Why Sue? You could have any woman in the world but --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: That's why. Because I could have any other woman... You know, when they asked Caesar "why England," he said, "because it's not mine."

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Make sure you find Ben, bring him back here. And keep it quiet. I don't need this to hit the press.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes sir. You've got the Mayor at eight, then a nine-thirty interview with the Journal --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Front page?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Top left, like you asked.  Today Wall Street. Tomorrow, who knows... maybe Washington.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You're, you've, I mean, how have you bee--

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Never better.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Those solar winds are flaring, but I factored them into my coordinates and --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I was talking about us. Working together.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Well, uh, based on our history... you can handle the biogenetics, and I'll focus on the molecular physics. Or, uhm, maybe I should take the biotech, you work the microscopes, since you have some background in electropho--

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Right. That's exactly what I meant.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I, uh, think I remember the number.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: It's been changed.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: As far as crew, I was hoping Ben could pilot the mission --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Well, he's welcome to ride shotgun, but we already have a pilot on our payroll. You remember my brother Johnny...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Material made from self-regulating unstable molecules. I've been working on a formula for this.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Great minds think alike.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Feeling better?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Yes, thanks.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: That's good. That's uh... good.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You always had a way with words.  I should be getting back.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You're happy for me and Victor.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I can tell you guys are enjoying what was the best part of our relationship --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Which was?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Passion.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: For science.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You are such a dork, Reed... You never got it and never will unless it's explained to you in quantum physics.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Uh, Sue...? I can't.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What? What do you mean you --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Sue... look at your hands.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: It has to be the cloud. It's fundamentally altered our DNA.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Let's not jump to conclusions, we need a massive amount of evidence before making that leap.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We need to get past them.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Sue. Your clothes. Lose them.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What...?  Oh.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: How come Ben can't turn it on and off like us?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: That's what we're here to find out.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: If it happened to him, then it could...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: It's not "invisibility" per se. You're bending the light around you with some kind of malleable force field. That's what you projected on the Bridge.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What about you? You haven't eaten in days. How come you're never on this side of the microscope?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You should be able to bend light around other objects, even people, if you could control your emotional state better --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I'm saying, if you had a little more self control, you could locate the trigger. Can you remember the exact emotions when --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Anger. Rage. Frustration.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Okay. Is there any way to duplicate that feeling? Some memory or...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm sure I can come up with something.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to do that... You must think that was some kind of latent hostility or --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: What in the world would give me that idea?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I mean, you broke up with me, right?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Are you kidding?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: No, I distinctly remember: you walked out my door. Ergo...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed. I was ready for the next step, you weren't, ergo, I walked.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I think it was a little more complicated than --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I just wanted to share an apartment. What was so complicated about that?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: There were a lot of variables to consider --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No. There weren't. There was you. And me. No variables, no math. It was actually the simplest thing in the world. But your head got in the way... like it always does.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The plants, from space. Their particles are still charged. With the right amount of energy, those ions could create the elemental profile of the cosmic storm.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: If we can build a machine to re-create the storm, we can reverse the polarity --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: And reverse the mutations --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Curing countless diseases, not just ours.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: But we're the focus, right Reed? Reed...?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Of course. Of course.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: And you sure you can control this thing? Last time didn't work out so well.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: With the right energy, we can stabilize the storm. Maybe tie into the city grid...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed. How close are we to a cure?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: No way to know. Without more tests, experiments.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Don't let Victor push you into making a mistake --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He was going to take away all my data, equipment --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Better than your life. Victor's not the one who has to get into that thing. We are.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Which is why I'm working twenty hours a day, checking every variable --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Every variable but yourself. You don't eat, sleep. You can't live in your head like --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I'm not the only one in there. I got you, Vic, Ben, Johnny, all rattling around in there.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I could get Ben to tap into the Baxter's main power to generate enough voltage --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed. Shh. Just be quiet. And look up.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Remember our first date here...? God, I was so nervous.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You were?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Of course I was. I'd read all your papers on bioethics. Some of them two times just so I'd have something to say to you.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You know, I bribed the projectionist ten bucks to keep it open late?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I gave him twenty.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You always talked about how you liked the kind of man who could approach you... speak his mind. One who wasn't afraid to tell you what he wanted.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I did. I did, Reed... but I wanted you to be that man.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: When I walked out, I waited ten minutes outside your door. Ten. Waiting for you to come find me.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Why didn't you say something?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: That would have kinda defeated the purpose. And Reed...  I'm saying it now.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I can... make it work.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed, stop, you need to rest your --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The power... I need... more power... to control... the storm --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You need a doctor.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Sue, I need some of that anger, rage, frustration --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm sure I can come up with something.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I found a broken gasket, from space --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: A gasket? Reed, we're at a party.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: But dreams don't pay the bills, do they?  Same old Reed, the hopeless optimist. Still reaching for the stars, with the world on your back.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You remember in school we talked about working together. That's what I was about to explain...

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: This isn't going to be a problem, is it?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You back this mission, and I'll sign over a fair percentage of any applications or --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: The number's seventy-five. And it's applications and patents.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Funny how things turn out, isn't it?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Hilarious.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Got it. So take a walk, Ben... I'm going to borrow Susan for a second.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We've got minutes until it hits, not hours... Victor, that storm's deadly -- the radiation's lethal. We need to abort.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Get a grip. Reed. We didn't come all this way to lose our nerve at the first little glitch. Just close the shields...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben's still out there --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: So reel him in. But we came here to do a job. So let's do it. Quickly.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Come on, Ben, come on...

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Reed, we're running out of time.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Not until Ben is back inside!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It's too late for him, and soon it'll be too late for all of us.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Just a little banged up. A couple scrapes. Why?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben did this.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Ben did this?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's had some kind of... reaction to exposure from the cloud. And he's not the only one.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'm starting to wonder the same thing... How much do you know about what happened to you?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Not much. We need to run tests to see the extent of the damage.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Didn't go as planned? It was a catastrophe. You ruined the lives of four people --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I ruined? With all due respect, I told you to abort --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Abort? Reed, I put my company, my name, billions of dollars on the line, and I will not let you make me look like a fool --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Victor, if we could understand what happened to us --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I don't want to understand it. This isn't one of your science projects. I just want to fix it. Fast!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What I should have done a long time ago. Applications and patents, Reed. This all belongs to me.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: But I'm not done with the machine --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Which is precisely the point. Analysis is over. It's time for action. My men could have mass-produced this by now.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: It's just business.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I think you both know my Director of Genetic Research, Susan Storm.
